fields.summary: Issue navigator marked overdue due-dates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36427].
  {panel}

I would like to add or remove one or several components as a bulk change to several issues in the meantime.

Today the only available bulk change operation on components does a replacement.

Please improve the Bulk Change functionality and provide the 3 Bulk *Add*, *Remove*, and *Replace* operations.

PS: I discovered several similar requests for versions and labels but none for components specifically. I also saw that this request is very old and many other customers already complained a lot. Is there any chance to include an improvement fix for this within the coming JIRA releases?
fields.summary: Allow bulk add or remove to component/s
The ability to configure the pop-up windows
Make Notification Types pluggable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36415].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian update - 16 July 2020 }
Hi everyone,

Today we have an update on Trash for Projects. We’re excited to announce that Trash for Projects is generally available as part of Jira Software.

Note that trash will work only for projects. It will not work for issues. We evaluated trash for issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions. I am keeping this ticket as "Gathering Interest" so that you votes and comments can help us gather more information. 

You can learn more about Trash for Projects at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/trash-for-jira-software-and-jira-core-projects-1001820064.html] 

Regards,
Ritesh Ranjan
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
Sometimes, users will accidentally delete issues, and the steps to restore those issues usually involves restoring backups, which would take quite a lot of time and effort.

As such, it would be great if JIRA had some sort of Recycle Bin or Trash (like in Confluence) so that users would be able to restore any accidentally deleted issues easily.
fields.summary: Have a Trash/Recycle Bin in JIRA
provide support for TIF, BMP and WMF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36409].
  {panel}

# Goto project admin as user with admin or sysadmin permission (project admin wont do).
# Goto the workflow tab.
# Click Add Workflow > Existing (make sure you have more than one workflow in JIRA).
# Select workflow.
# Click next
# (BUG) As shown below the back and finish buttons are not correctly aligned.

!aligned_not.png!
fields.summary: Back and Finish Button not aligned on Workflow Dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36408].
  {panel}

# Create a new advanced search in the issue navigator.
# Save the search as a filter.
# Load the filter.
# Change the JQL. You should now have a save button.
# (BUG) Click save. You get a message saying your filter has been updated, but the UI still shows the "Save" button and still indicates that the filter is not saved.

!no_save.png!

The actual query appears to be saved.
fields.summary: Clicking Save on a filter does not update the issue nav to indicate the filter is not modified
Display a message after copying a Workflow Scheme
Facebook style notifications

fields.description:
Dashboard gadgets, in both the system dashboard and within individualized dashboards, fail to render properly after upgrading to EAP version 6.2 (m03). The following error is present where the gadget should be:

Error loading gadget from rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets/gadgets/login.xml: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 404

I researched this issue, and explored the 4 options presented here (none of which could resolve the issue): https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=222200924

Is this a known issue with EAP releases?

  {panel}

Any status that has a translation will not show the translation in the workflow popup, instead the system name will be shown.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Translate the statuses from the Status screen (for example, translate Open to Example for German)
# Switch your user profile to the Language you selected in step one
# Go to an issue which is in that status
** The issue screen will show the correct translation
# Click on the 'View Workflow' link next to the current status

*Result:* The status will show as 'open' rather than 'Example' in the workflow diagram popup

This applies to any language selected.

We are currently testing out JIRA Service Desk with JIRA. When I try to clone an issue that was orginally created from Service Desk in JIRA, then I am getting an Issue Ranking Operation error. 

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Create request in Service Desk.
2. Go to JIRA, find created request/issue. 
3. Attempt to Clone issue. The attached screenshots are seen. 

Note: We followed these instructions: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=269982614

We restarted Jira and still got the error. Then we ran the delete from AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKINGLOG; SQL, then we restarted and we're still having the problem.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36373].
  {panel}

Hello,

I have found that adding Log Work to an issue transition screen prevents auto-transition scripts (from the Script Runner plugin) from executing.  This was discussed in more detail in this Answers post: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/192003/auto-transition-an-issue-when-remaining-estimate-is-0?page=1#comment-215515

Below is the specific scenario in which I discovered this: 

*This works:*

On a working existing transition, I have a number of fields including "Remaining Estimate" BUT NOT "Log Work".
This transition fires a Generic Event
I have a "Fast-track transition an issue" script listener set up to listen for Generic Events where the condition is 
issue.estimate == 0
The script is designed to execute a separate (shortcut) transition that moves the issue to a closed status, when this condition is met.
This is done by the user changing the Remaining Estimate field to 0 in the original transition.

*This does NOT work:*

On a working existing transition, I have a number of fields including "Remaining Estimate" AND "Log Work".
This transition fires a Generic Event
I have a "Fast-track transition an issue" script listener set up to listen for Generic Events where the condition is 
issue.estimate == 0
The script is designed to execute a separate (shortcut) transition that moves the issue to a closed status, when this condition is met.
This is done by the user changing the Remaining Estimate field to 0 in the original transition.

*This also does NOT work:*

On a working existing transition, I have a number of fields including "Remaining Estimate" AND "Log Work".
This transition fires a Log Work Event
I have a "Fast-track transition an issue" script listener set up to listen for Log Work Events where the condition is 
issue.estimate == 0
The script is designed to execute a separate (shortcut) transition that moves the issue to a closed status when this condition is met.
This is done by the user Logging Work that brings the Remaining Estimate field to 0 in the original transition.
hope that helps. It's really just that it works without the "Log Work" field on a transition screen but as soon as that's added it no longer works.


Thanks,
Pat
fields.summary: Adding Log Work to Issue transition screen prevents auto-transition script from executing

fields.description:
Try this basic curl example that is supposed to perform REST search using SQL. 

It seems that in this case JIRA assumes that project is a custom field and not a project, that's really weird. It does not matter what value you put for the project filter, you will get the same error, even if the project exists or not.

This reproduces with latest JIRA: 6.1.5 and 5.2.11 too.

Don't forget to specify credentials inside {{~/.netrc}} file.

{code}
curl -N  -X POST --data '{ "jql": "project = XXX", "startAt": 0, "maxResults": 9999, "fields": [ "summary", "status", "assignee" ]}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://locahost/rest/api/2/search"

{"errorMessages":["The value 'XXX' does not exist for the field 'project'."],"errors":{}}++ exit
{code}
fields.summary: REST error "The value 'XXX' does not exist for the field 'project'."] while performing search with SQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36333].
  {panel}

h4. Background
Creating workflows usually means creating new Issue Types and new Status values.  When using Basic Search, the "Status" drop-down displays all Status values --- out-of-the-box as well as those we've added.

h4. Usability Challenge
After filtering on Issue Type, the "Status" drop-down still shows all Status values, many of which don't apply to the selected Issue Type.  _That is, by virtue of the associated Workflow(s), an Issue of the selected Type could never transition to certain Statuses._

Let's say we define a "Business Requirement" Issue Type, and associate it with a new Workflow that allows Issues to have the following Status values:

* In Progress
* Ready for Customer Review
* Customer Approved
* Customer Rejected

If a user searches for "Business Requirement" Issues that have a Status of "Closed", there would be no matches.

h4. Suggestion
Because criteria for Basic Search are applied with AND --- not OR --- it makes sense to use "progressive disclosure" in the drop-downs.  So if there are any values specified in the "Type" drop-down, the options available in the "Status" drop-down would be determined by:

{code}select * from status
left join workflow on (status is defined in workflow)
left join issuetype on (issuetype is assigned to workflow){code}

Similarly, the "Type" drop-down options could be limited based on the value(s) selected for the "Project" drop-down.

Also, since this functionality might degrade response time, allow an Administrator to enable/disable it.

(!) {color:red} *Devil's advocate says:*
What happens when a user filters on two Issue Types, and then selects a Status value that applies only to the first, and _another_ Status value that applies only to the second?{color}
This scenario can be tested even without the suggested functionality.  It doesn't appear to be a problem...

h4. Alternative Considerations
It occurred to me that a more appropriate approach might be for my team to create a Custom Field for "Business Requirement Status" instead of piggybacking onto the out-of-the-box Status field.  But given that we _are_ allowed to add our own values to the Status field, there is still a case for the suggested functionality.
fields.summary: In "Status" drop-down (Basic Search), only show options for selected issue Type (a.k.a. "progressive disclosure")

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36316].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA runs each post-function of a transition unconditionally. The only way to provide conditions is to define multiple transitions separated by conditions. This would lead to an exponentially growing number of alternate transitions as number of post-functions (and conditions) grow. 

It would be useful if we could define condition(s) for individual post-functions of a single transition. Something like:
1-Run post-function A
2-Run post-function B if user is in group X.
3-Run post-function C if (mycustomfield = Y and user is in role Z)

There are some add-ons in the market that introduce post-functions that have conditions. But those conditions apply only to those specific post-functions. If JIRA supports conditions then all post-functions, both system and add-on, can become conditional.

The same mechanism and library for transition conditions can be used. This way any new transition condition functions introduced by an add-on could also be used for post-function conditions.

I don't know the inner workings of JIRA of course but I believe this could be implemented without breaking anything else and would give much more power and flexibility to the already powerful JIRA workflow engine.
fields.summary: Ability to define a condition for each post function

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36307].
  {panel}

The differences between supported platform across Atlassian products can cause major confusion on the customer side.

For example, for latest JIRA 6.1.5 and Confluence 5.4 , the differences is tolerate-able. However, we are to compare JIRA 6.1.5 and Bamboo 5.3 (both latest) we can see huge differences. Eg:
* JIRA supporting only OracleJDK 1.7, Bamboo does support OpenJDK 1.7 and OracleJDK 1.6 and 1.7
* JIRA only support Tomcat 7 , Bamboo does support Tomcat 5,6,7
* JIRA support Postgresql 8.3, 8.4 and 9.0 , meanwhile Bamboo supporting only 8.2+ (can't be sure if this mean PostgreSQL version 8.2 and above)

If we are to add FishEye 3.2 to this equation:

* FishEye support Postgresql 8.2 , 8.3 and 8.4 .

Even though, some of the versions does match for the applications , it does not allow the customer to have a consistent versions of platform that they should use. Upgrading platforms like database is a challenge as we do not have a specific page for users with multiple product running. We should at least has a central page to recommend customer what environment is the best for every major release as this is when we evaluate the Supported Platform.
fields.summary: Documentation request - supported platform page for all Atlassian products

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36300].
  {panel}

*Feedback from a customer:*

Whenever you run Indexing and for some reason it fails, you remove the existing working index and leave the system inoperable. It makes it look like all of the users have lost their data. In reality until you fix the index error, then everything comes back.

My suggestion is to:

Keep the existing working Index and only remove it when the current run is successful. If for whatever reason the current indexing run fails, then the system would still remain usable until the indexing error is corrected. You should be backing up the current working index in case the current indexing run fails.
I understand that the error has to be corrected but if you do what I suggest, then at least it doesn't cause a crisis for the JIRA Admins until the problem is fixed.
fields.summary: JIRA should backup current working index in case reindexing fails.

Hi!

We use the Jira for project management and we adopt Category as "Customer".
Now I need migrate our defects management from Bugzilla to Jira.

In our process, components and versions are attributes of "products" (products are the systems resulting from our projects). In other words, we execute several projects to improve the same product!

I think that we should not duplicate all the versions and components configurations for each new project of the same product...

The subcomponents solution have the same problem... all structure (components/subcomponents) are exclusive to one unique project...

I think that if the Jira had projects hierarchy, we can use the level 1 as product and project level 1.1 as project, with components reuse (as the Mantis tool can do). Or something like it.

What's your current position about this issue JRA-12241?
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12241

What solution do you indicate to my need?

Thanks a lot!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36249].
  {panel}

* When adding a new watcher, it is momentarily visible in the Watchers inline dialog, even when the server returns an error
* When opening the Watchers inline dialog, the previously added watcher is momentarily visible, even if the server returned an error.
* Sometimes the inline dialog jumps to the top-left corner (I can't reproduce that).

This is caused by the REST resource. When you add a watcher it optimistically adds it to the model, then fires off an XHR. If this XHR returns an error (eg. user does not have permission to view the issue/project) then the model isn't updated. This happens because the XHR doesn't return an error - it returns a 20x response, but without the user to remove.
fields.summary: On a slow connection, when adding watchers and there is an error, the new watcher is visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36248].
  {panel}

h4. +Current Scenario+
It's currently possible to integrate JIRA with a SSO tool - see [Single Sign-on Integration with JIRA and Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Single+Sign-on+Integration+with+JIRA+and+Confluence]. However, JIRA will show any pages that do not require login (such as https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa). Which leads user to be rerouted to JIRA login page, instead of the SSO

h4. +Suggestion+
Add an option to JIRA's *General Configuration* to redirect any users that are not yet logged in to the SSO to the log in page in the SSO.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, I'd like to force all users to authenticate to the SSO before seeing any pages in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36241].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how your teams work and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

We have decided to close this specific request for _additional status categories_ as Won't Fix. The finite set of status categories allows us to build useful features on top of them, like completion progress indicators for Epics and Versions.

We recognize that for many teams, most of the steps in a workflow are "In Progress" and that it can be difficult to distinguish them. Here are some strategies:
 * Add additional columns to your board for different workflow states. You can have several "In Progress" columns to represent concepts like "In Development" or "Under Review".
 * Use the card colors based on JQL queries feature ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-colours]) to define your own colors for workflow states. I've created this suggestion in the JIRA Agile project to improve this in the future: GHS-11666
 * Use JIRA Agile card layouts (new in JIRA Agile 6.6) to show the workflow state on the card ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-fields])
 * To customize the display of issues within the JIRA issue navigator, consider the free third-party [icnavigator add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icnavigator.jira-icnavigator] from Interconcept GmbH.

We do not plan to support arbitrary colors for status categories. The mapping of blue, yellow, and green to "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" is part of [Atlassian's overall visual system|https://design.atlassian.com/latest/product/components/lozenges/]. Our intent is to improve how we use this pattern to communicate information in JIRA; however, we use the combination of colors and lozenges to represent concepts not only in JIRA, but across Atlassian's product suite.

Finally, there were specific requests for a "Red" status color. The main use case here was situations where an issue had progressed to the end of a workflow, but the resolution was negative (e.g. "Failed" instead of "Done"). In JIRA's structure, this connects the final workflow state (i.e. "Resolved") with the type of resolution. While there's certainly merit in this request, it has the potential to significantly increase JIRA's complexity.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}
The new status colors in JIRA provides initial set of pre-defined statues. It would also be beneficial to add the ability for users to add more categories to it
fields.summary: Ability to add more categories to statuses
